titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Kenneth N. Dayton Papers FA031

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-08-02 00:39:00 -0400.

change.item: Migrated from Re:discovery to the Archivists' Toolkit by Marisa Hudspeth

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Kenneth N. Dayton was a trustee of the Rockefeller Foundation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Kenneth N. Dayton's papers contain material on the nomination of a new president of the Rockefeller Foundation.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) or audiovisual material (audio cassettes, VHS, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: RAC users must abide by all applicable provisions of United States copyright law. Reproduction/duplication of archival items is routinely provided in accordance with "fair use." If the RAC does not hold copyright for an archival collection, or items within a collection, it is the user's responsibility to contact the copyright holder, or make a fair effort to do so, prior to publication.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Kenneth N. Dayton papers were accessioned in 1987 and opened for research in 1998.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php
